urls.title: Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Combining Nordic design, atmosphere and hospitality, our lounges at Helsinki Airport invite you to spend a hassle-free moment before your flight. There are three lounges at Helsinki Airport – Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side and Finnair Business Lounge and Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of the airport.

data.text: Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of Helsinki Airport opens its doors again on 1 June! Platinum Wing welcomes Finnair Plus Platinum Lumo and Platinum members as well as oneworld Emerald members with limited opening hours from 11.30 am to 6 pm: https://t.co/UzI3bxjLBg https://t.co/XQbWGNiS5P

data.text: Hundreds of stunning Greek islands dotted across the Aegean and Ionian seas await! If you don’t want to pick just one, book our one-way flights and explore different destinations on an island-hopping adventure.  https://t.co/28TRle9VEx

urls.title: Pets on Finnair flights
urls.description: Information about transporting pets on Finnair flights.

data.text: Are you travelling with your pet? Once you have booked flights for yourself, please inform us about your pet within 24h via our chatbot. When your pet is travelling in the cabin, the total weight of the pet and its carrier may not exceed 8kg (17lb). https://t.co/YGwvljkmUR

urls.title: Facemask policy on our flights
urls.description: Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. As coronavirus pandemic is moving to a new phase and coronavirus related restrictions are being removed across countries, we at Finnair are lifting the requirement to wear a face mask on board our flights. Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. On flights where using a mask is an authority requirement,

data.text: Please note that using a face mask on our flights is optional unless required by your destination or origin authorities. Remember to check from our travel update, whether using a mask is still mandatory on your flight: https://t.co/AdJ6twvtM9 https://t.co/APF0gGy4pq

As the Official Sponsor of the Finnish National Team at the 2022 IIHF World Championship, we want to wish them the best of luck for the upcoming tournament hosted this year in Finland. Let’s go @leijonat! https://t.co/ZXcV7MacMt

data.text: Pack your swimsuit and sunscreen, it’s time to start the beach holiday season! In our new destination Larnaca, you can enjoy Finikoudes Beach's impeccably clear water and fine sand near the city centre. Check out our five top picks for beach destinations: https://t.co/C6eqvc0n8s

urls.title: Use our handy and quick online services for Finnair Plus members
urls.description: Finnair offers many digital services for our Plus members, and we are even developing new online features constantly. You can for example take care of your bookings, update your personal information, or use your Finnair Plus points online. As a Finnair Plus member you have the option to handle most of your travel and membership needs online. Our fast-developing digital services mean that you need to contact our customer servic e less and less. - The most important benefit for our customers is speed. Our

data.text: We offer multiple digital services for our Finnair Plus members and develop new online features constantly. As a Finnair Plus member, you can take care of your bookings, update your personal information or use your Finnair Plus points online. Read more: https://t.co/lyUcZ3Ay4e

data.text:
Dreaming about your next Helsinki trip? Fill your appetite at Kallio’s restaurants and cocktail bars, wander at Kalasatama exploring urban art pieces or spend a while in cozy Vallila between lovely pastel-coloured wooden apartments.

Check out our tips: https://t.co/ZwEKplXwQV https://t.co/YgVmZfuAau

urls.title: New cabin
urls.description: Experience the new sensation of flying with Finnair. Our redesigned long-haul cabin will elevate your travel experience to a whole new level.

data.text: Learn how our experts reimagined Finnair’s travel experience in a 6-part series. Kristina reveals how people are at the core of our new service concept giving our customers more privacy and freedom of choice while simplifying processes for our cabin crew. https://t.co/6fxOnuDb6b https://t.co/AlLUU6wJZh

urls.title: New cabin
urls.description: Experience the new sensation of flying with Finnair. Our redesigned long-haul cabin will elevate your travel experience to a whole new level.

data.text: Today is the day! The first flights with our elevated long-haul experience – the renewed Business Class, totally new Premium Economy Class and the refreshed Economy Class – take off. See you on board! Discover more: https://t.co/azubqOuzLr https://t.co/nVsp5oKooa

Our new long-haul menus have been designed by our chefs in Finnair Kitchen focusing on pure and fresh flavours drawing on our Nordic heritage and complemented with local elements. https://t.co/GNrCh3Sts3

urls.title: Change your booking flexibly
urls.description: With our updated ticket policy, you can now change your travel dates with more flexibility. Book Finnair flights and travel with confidence!

data.text: Our flexible booking policy is valid until 31 May. Please note that our normal ticket rules will apply for bookings made from 1 June onwards. You can add extra flexibility with our Classic or Flex ticket types, or by purchasing Finnair Cancellation Cover. https://t.co/NQN3hfI84T

urls.title: Finnair’s new signature cocktail inspired by the sunset takes off to the skies
urls.description: From 11 May onwards, you can enjoy our brand-new signature cocktail, created together with Danish Mikropolis Cocktails. Plenty of lingonberries, a splash of gin and a dash of orange peel bring you a whole new form of enjoyment on our long-haul flights. Sit back and relax, your long-haul flight is about to take off. Maybe admire the stunning view above the clouds, perhaps the beautiful sunset glowing in the shades of red, orange and yellow. Let us introduce you our new signature drink, Northern Blush,

data.text: Plenty of lingonberries, a splash of gin and a dash of orange peel – introducing the new Finnair signature drink, Northern Blush, created together with Danish Mikropolis Cocktails. Available on our long-haul flights from 11 May onwards. Read more: https://t.co/ZfNAibumEo https://t.co/Zsz1b8ugpf

Where is the flavoursome potato gnocchi a must-eat and where to find the best velvety saffron-flavoured risotto? See our mouth-watering tips for all our six destinations in Italy: https://t.co/5k1SxCZTo9

urls.title: Facemask policy on our flights
urls.description: Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. As coronavirus pandemic is moving to a new phase and coronavirus related restrictions are being removed across countries, we at Finnair are lifting the requirement to wear a face mask on board our flights. Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. On flights where using a mask is an authority requirement,

data.text: Please note that using a face mask on our flights is optional unless required by your destination or origin authorities. Remember to check from our travel update, whether using a mask is still mandatory on your flight: https://t.co/AdJ6tww1BH https://t.co/XHvmF4Nufu

In April, Finnair carried 680,300 passengers, which was 740.4% more than in April 2021. The number of passengers in April 2022 was 10.7% more than in March 2022 (month-on-month figures are not fully comparable as there was one fewer day in April). https://t.co/6MbAFr83co https://t.co/AlCvtRwmxc

urls.title: Welcome to Finnair Plus
urls.description: Finnair Plus is Finnair’s frequent flyer program. As a Finnair Plus member you can earn and use points on flights and enjoy other great benefits. Join now!

data.text: This month we’re celebrating 30 years of Finnair Plus! As a thank you of our journey together, we offer you great anniversary month benefits, such as flight offers and triple Finnair Plus points. Discover our brilliant birthday offers and learn more: https://t.co/5KtNmJMB8S https://t.co/u7r4zlYNrw

urls.title: Upgrade your travel class
urls.description: Make your Finnair flight even more pleasant with an upgrade to Business Class or our brand-new Premium Economy Class.

data.text: Premium Economy Class upgrades are now available through our customer service with credit cards, Finnair Plus points and upgrade benefits. Through Sisu chatbot, you can request an upgrade with points or upgrade benefits without having to queue. https://t.co/0MZc5NB5M2 https://t.co/0aZIAqSl2t
RT @ZagrebAirport: Yesterday we welcomed @Finnair - another new airline in this year's summer timetable. Finnair will connect #Helsinki and…

From today onwards, we operate our domestic Turku and Tampere routes both by air and with a new kind of bus connection that smoothly links to and from connecting flights at Helsinki Airport. Read more: https://t.co/FZ1b23ZVKe

We are excited to start flying to a new European destination, Zagreb, this Sunday. The capital of Croatia is an excellent choice for culture enthusiasts, and your perfect holiday is guaranteed with great restaurants and gorgeous nearby islands. https://t.co/0leJVv3aSa
Read our new Investor Relations blog post about  Finnair's Q1 results. https://t.co/PNjAaa1Fwo

urls.description: Finnair flies the shortcut between Europe and Asia. Start by selecting your country and preferred language and then proceed to booking your flights.

data.text: Finnair supports Ukrainians with a 95% discount on net fares for one-way tickets from Warsaw, Krakow, Gdansk, Budapest and Prague to Helsinki. The discount is available with code Ukraine95 at https://t.co/eiciaI8FAY until 31 May. Taxes and fees will be added to ticket prices. https://t.co/piskr1IqZG

urls.title: Inspiration, information and travel extras to make your holiday planning easy
urls.description: Planning your next unforgettable holiday is easy with Finnair’s wide range of digital services. There are several services available on Finnair.com that will help you to easily plan your trip and also tailor your journey with travel extras. Still deciding on your next destination? Check out our Flight offers page to find out which destinations we currently have in our network, and what the starting from fares are. You can also search destinations by country and see, for instance, all our destinations in

data.text: Planning your summer holiday? Check the schedules for different destinations easily on our Timetables page, find out possible travel requirements from our travel requirements map and add travel extras to your reservation in Manage booking. https://t.co/13SYED6Ndu

urls.title: Finnair's carbon offset service
urls.description: Join us on our most important journey and offset your flight emissions.

data.text: Did you know that you can now calculate and offset the carbon footprint from your flights with our service that combines Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) and trusted climate projects? Join our journey toward carbon neutrality and read more: https://t.co/hFMR40evx1 https://t.co/JHMx8jFQrW

Recovery from the pandemic progresses at a pace whilst we are adapting to the reality of the closed Russian airspace. Read Finnair Group Interim Report 1 January – 31 March 2022 here: https://t.co/hISOS6JZxI https://t.co/Ln8DMV0fC8

urls.title: Facemask policy on our flights
urls.description: Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. As coronavirus pandemic is moving to a new phase and coronavirus related restrictions are being removed across countries, we at Finnair are lifting the requirement to wear a face mask on board our flights. Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. On flights where using a mask is an authority requirement,

data.text: As of today, you are no longer required to wear a facemask on Finnair flights, unless it’s required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. Please check the mask requirements of your origin and destination country before travelling: https://t.co/AdJ6twvtM9 https://t.co/NbJ24F1EUB

As coronavirus related restrictions are removed across countries, we will close the Finnair coronavirus test point near Helsinki Airport on 30 May. We continue to offer our customers discounted coronavirus testing options with our partners. https://t.co/LzGZBYEgSs

urls.title: Five reasons Finnair's new Business Class is the ultimate way to travel
urls.description: Finnair’s all new Business Class cabin, rolling out across our entire long haul fleet throughout 2022 and 2023, is a true game changer. With an incredible seat, gorgeous Nordic design and food inspired by our roots as well as our destinations, it’s set to be the ultimate way to travel between Europe, the USA and Asia. Here are five reasons why you should book a ticket now and get set to take to the skies. It’s the first thing you’ll notice when you board. Our new Air Lounge seat is a spectacular piece of

data.text: With the incredible AirLounge seat, gorgeous Nordic design and food inspired by both our roots and destinations, Finnair’s renewed long-haul Business Class is set to be the ultimate way to travel. Check out 5 reasons why you should book your ticket now: https://t.co/5MVFEfkiJn https://t.co/hvxnRt8gcl

urls.title: Smooth travelling at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Flying via Helsinki means that you can enjoy the compact and uncrowded Helsinki Airport, where all the gates and services are located under one roof, in one terminal building. Helsinki Airport welcomes you with its new spacious arrival and departure halls! As the main transit area for Finnair customers, the brand-new terminal will make connections extra quick and smooth. Catching a train, bus or taxi to or from the airport is now easier than ever as everything is nearby the terminal entrance. The

data.text: Helsinki Airport’s beautiful, new terminal building opened in December, and all Finnair departure hall services are now at your service in the new terminal. Security control is partly available in the new premises and partly in the old until late May. https://t.co/pbtG4v5GH3

urls.title: New cabin
urls.description: Experience the new sensation of flying with Finnair. Our redesigned long-haul cabin will elevate your travel experience to a whole new level.

data.text:
The first episode of our 6-part series of creating the elevated long-haul experience explores how David challenged the traditional idea of an aircraft to create an elevated and distinctly Nordic travel experience featuring renewed Business Class.

https://t.co/cRERPi2rZC https://t.co/KYwQRcb5Bm

Seattle, known as the Emerald City, offers breathtakingly beautiful nature, great restaurants, world-famous architecture, lots of museums and art galleries and many intriguing neighbourhoods: https://t.co/AlUKD4qB9l. Finnair flies to Seattle from 1 June onwards 3 times per week. https://t.co/1W6zlkEXbE

urls.title: Tips for travelling during the summer season and peak hours
urls.description: We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season. During the peak hours and busier times, the number of customers at the airports and on our flights increases. Busy times are expected from time to time, and various service points as well as security checks may be congested. Also, this summer quickly increased travel and global labour shortages of airport operators and ground service providers, are causing congestion at many European airports. Below you’ll find some tips on

data.text: As the number of customers at Helsinki Airport and on our flights increases during the busier travel times, we recommend you do the check-in in advance and arrive at the airport early to get a smooth start to your journey. See all our tips for peak hours: https://t.co/9BZEPE2jJH https://t.co/0hiDnKh2Vz

Dreaming of a spring getaway? Check out our tips for 3 city break destinations in Europe and find out where to find the most beautiful flowers in London, where to enjoy spring to the fullest in Prague and what there is to do in Verona this time of year: https://t.co/DZXiOVdGMQ https://t.co/h7ELbuvmZd

Combining different modes of transport is one way to reduce the carbon footprint. From 2 May onwards, we operate to Turku and Tampere by flying and with a new kind of bus connection – both are on sale now. Read more: https://t.co/FZ1b23ZVKe https://t.co/9Ao8HQasCA

urls.title: Sights, scents, and flavours in Singapore
urls.description: Singapore really has it all: some of the best shopping in the world, more food options than you can imagine, entertainment to keep you busy for years and lots of green space for relaxing. Open your senses and take it all in! Singapore's famous Hawker Centres, cooked food markets, are the place to go if you want to sample a variety of great quality local dishes - for a modest price tag. The most popular is Lau Pa Sat seating over 2000 people. The offering includes traditional dishes such as Hor Fun (a

data.text: Singapore really has it all: more food options than you can imagine, entertainment to keep you busy, lots of green space to enjoy and endless shopping opportunities. Check out our tips for intriguing Singapore to make the most of your next trip: https://t.co/p39N4R97ov. https://t.co/Gu2TcShFhs

urls.title: Use our handy and quick online services for Finnair Plus members
urls.description: Finnair offers many digital services for our Plus members, and we are even developing new online features constantly. You can for example take care of your bookings, update your personal information, or use your Finnair Plus points online. As a Finnair Plus member you have the option to handle most of your travel and membership needs online. Our fast-developing digital services mean that you need to contact our customer servic e less and less. - The most important benefit for our customers is speed. Our

data.text: We offer multiple digital services for our Finnair Plus members and develop new online features constantly. You can, for example, take care of your bookings, update your personal information or use your Finnair Plus points online. Read more: https://t.co/lyUcZ3Ay4e

Yesterday marked 30 years since we resumed flights between Helsinki and Riga. The first flights to Riga started back in 1927. They were suspended due to the division of Europe during World War II and the post-war period. We currently have three daily flights to Riga. https://t.co/hFlE2mt0DD

urls.title: Nature experiences, well-being, and snow adventures in Lapland
urls.description: Lapland is at its best in the spring side of winter. There is no lack of snowy slopes, and the days are growing longer and sunnier. The different resorts offer plenty to choose from, whether you are a keen sportsperson, looking for local flavours, wanting to try out new activities or just need to rewind in nature. Ivalo is the travel center of Northern Lapland; it has the most nort hern airport in the EU as well as great services such as hotels and restaurants. Ivalo is known for its truly unique nature

data.text: Lapland is magical all year around, and during the springtime, you can enjoy glittering snow blankets in the spring sun. Days are getting warmer and longer, but there is still plenty of snow to enjoy. What's your favourite destination in Northern Finland? https://t.co/Q1mZmI21Si https://t.co/4NSbkHqBb2

urls.title: Flying over the North Pole: Well-planned is half done
urls.description: On 9 March 2022, flight AY073 from Helsinki to Tokyo Narita departed at 17:30 local time. However, instead of heading east, the flight headed towards the North Pole. With this flight, Finnair resumed its service to Tokyo Narita, skirting around Russian airspace that closed on 28 February. Back in 1983, Finnair was the first airline to fly non-stop from Europe to Japan, flying over the North Pole – so operating in the polar region is not new to Finnair. But after a break of almost 30 years, there were a

data.text: Since Russia closed its airspace on 28 February, we have had to find alternative routes for our Asian flights. If your flight is operated over the North Pole, we will reward you with a Northern route diploma, which was also handed out back in the 1980s. https://t.co/wtve1YU4LI https://t.co/Mb9mC8Dtzn

urls.title: Smooth travelling at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Flying via Helsinki means that you can enjoy the compact and uncrowded Helsinki Airport, where all the gates and services are located under one roof, in one terminal building. Helsinki Airport welcomes you with its new spacious arrival and departure halls! As the main transit area for Finnair customers, the brand-new terminal will make connections extra quick and smooth. Catching a train, bus or taxi to or from the airport is now easier than ever as everything is nearby the terminal entrance. The

data.text: Helsinki Airport is going through a total transformation to offer you a seamless journey. We are gradually moving Finnair departure hall services to the new premises by mid-April, starting from next week already. Read more: https://t.co/pbtG4v5GH3

urls.title: Finnair's carbon offset service

data.text: Join our journey towards carbon neutrality – you can now calculate and offset the carbon footprint from your flights with our service that combines Sustainable Aviation Fuel and trusted climate projects. Read more: https://t.co/hFMR40evx1 https://t.co/QOUClScH07

data.text: With Russian airspace closed, Finnair’s traffic planning and operations teams have worked hard to replan our Asian flights. When planning the detour around Russia, winds or jet streams play a key role. https://t.co/bIS2f2VG2V

We continue to serve Seoul and Shanghai from Helsinki but cancel flights to Osaka and Hong Kong until the end of April due to the closure of Russian airspace. If there are changes to your flight, we will contact you via email or text. https://t.co/jkhcVpRBqB https://t.co/qsZfhjRIgr

urls.title: Changes in Finnair flights to Asia and Russia
urls.description: Due to the closure of Russian airspace, Finnair is making changes to its flights to Asian destinations and Russia. Due to the closure of Russian airspace, we are making changes to our flights to Asian destinations and Russia. We are using a longer route to Tokyo, Shanghai, Soul, Bangkok, Delhi and Singapore to avoid Russian airspace. We have cancelled all flights to Russia for the time being. In addition, flights to Hongkong are cancelled until 30 June 2022 and Osaka flights until 29 October 2022. Safety

data.text: We have cancelled our Seoul flights AY41/42 on 9/10 March and 11/12 March. We continue to seek solutions for operating our Asian routes avoiding the Russian airspace, and will communicate more once further plans are defined. For more, please see: https://t.co/aKtwZu200h https://t.co/EohhsoZJfw

We will resume our flights to Tokyo Narita as of 9 March with four weekly frequencies avoiding the Russian airspace. The flight times will be approximately 13 hours and the flights connect smoothly to our European network via Helsinki Airport. Read more: https://t.co/rmuhSXVbpG https://t.co/Voymza2AyN

urls.title: Harri Koskinen: The Finnish designer on bringing his Iittala vision to Finnair
urls.description: As Finland’s foremost living designer, Harri Koskinen knows all about the beauty, form and functionality needed to create the very best in Nordic design. His Block lamp has been part of MoMA’s permanent collection since 2000, while his Muu chair won him the prestigious Compasso d’Oro Award in 2004. Koskinen has also worked with iconic Finnish table and glassware brand Iittala throughout his career, from a scholarship in their glass factory after university in 1996, through to a period as its design

data.text: The new Iittala Kuulas tableware is created for Finnair by one of Finland’s foremost living designers, Harri Koskinen. Koskinen knows all about the beauty, form and functionality needed to create the very best in Nordic design. Read more: https://t.co/8euebZcljb
